title: Automatically filled passwords are not accepted
body:
### Describe the Bug

When logging in using Firefox (on Windows and Fedora) on Umami with autofilled passwords, Umami does not allow submission of the form (front-end) because it thinks fields are not filled. After changing some characters in the fields, submission is allowed and login proceeds as expected.

For both Umami and Firefox, I am using the most recent versions.

### Database

PostgreSQL

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Which browser are you using? (if relevant)

Firefox

### How are you deploying your application? (if relevant)

Docker (behind nginx https proxy)

title: Huge sudden drop in number of visitors (sessions) after upgrading to v2.9.0
body:
### Describe the Bug

We upgraded from 2.7.0 to v2.9.0 on December 19th. This caused a huge drop in the visitors (sessions) count for all all websites as can be seen below:

![image](https://github.com/umami-software/umami/assets/1722965/8f5cacce-75d5-4fb8-97f8-7af36bd46a1f)

This continues into January.

Since the views (pageview events) has not changed much, this can only mean views are now more concentrated across less visitors (sessions). We went from ~2 views/visitor/day on average, to ~10 views/visitor/day on average.

Running this query:

```sql
SELECT s.session_id, top_sessions.count AS pageviews, s.hostname, s.browser, s.os, s.device, s.screen FROM session s JOIN (SELECT e.session_id, count(e.session_id) FROM website_event e WHERE e.event_type = 1 AND e.website_id = 'mywebsiteid' AND e.created_at BETWEEN '2023-12-07' AND '2023-12-18' GROUP BY e.session_id ORDER BY count(e.session_id) DESC LIMIT 10) AS top_sessions ON s.session_id = top_sessions.session_id;
```

We can get the get the Top 10 session_ids by pageview count in the 12 days from December 7th to December 18th, before the upgrade:

```
              session_id              | pageviews |    hostname     | browser |     os     | device  |  screen
--------------------------------------+-----------+-----------------+---------+------------+---------+-----------
 e85067d6-6569-5afb-9d38-84c8c96467cb |        41 | www.website.com | ios     | iOS        | mobile  | 393x852
 e24894c3-76d1-582a-a1ff-7becec3c8c3d |        31 | www.website.com | chrome  | Windows 10 | desktop | 1920x1080
 5509fd77-5a93-5372-b0ec-223d33ccbf76 |        31 | www.website.com | safari  | Mac OS     | desktop | 2048x1152
 e3c476f7-221f-5e24-9f18-f09e269d0ca8 |        27 | www.website.com | ios     | iOS        | mobile  | 393x852
 c90eab1e-ef35-5f90-9c00-3e019a5605c1 |        21 | www.website.com | firefox | Linux      | laptop  | 1366x768
 459a7bb0-e9ed-5cc2-a285-4d1eca9a7fb9 |        20 | www.website.com | ios     | iOS        | mobile  | 393x852
 9d8cb764-4f6c-50cc-9a0e-96face7eee83 |        18 | www.website.com | ios     | iOS        | mobile  | 414x896
 33e410ad-8f53-53df-a743-4799785d44f3 |        18 | www.website.com | ios     | iOS        | mobile  | 390x844
 bc070bf5-d5da-5147-8222-1e520817f284 |        17 | www.website.com | chrome  | Windows 10 | desktop | 1920x1080
 ffd00f48-e680-5b56-84eb-f3f3eafd4979 |        16 | www.website.com | chrome  | Windows 10 | desktop | 1920x1080
```

And from December 20th and December 31st, after the upgrade:

```
              session_id              | pageviews |    hostname     |    browser    |     os     | device  |  screen
--------------------------------------+-----------+-----------------+---------------+------------+---------+-----------
 7d66612e-3661-5fc7-aad4-f2b7e8e28bd5 |      2702 | www.website.com | ios           | iOS        | mobile  | 430x932
 9a3ae813-616d-5ea0-a782-35d76892bf8d |      1112 | www.website.com | chrome        | Android OS | mobile  | 412x1006
 300147ec-b51e-5934-9a97-5da8c054edc6 |       615 | www.website.com | chrome        | Windows 10 | laptop  | 1280x720
 30a62591-9d5d-514b-92eb-d2aee1b057d9 |       427 | www.website.com | ios           | iOS        | mobile  | 430x932
 78748dc1-88d8-59d2-8262-329895cc000c |       404 | www.website.com | ios           | iOS        | mobile  | 375x812
 4b5980de-84da-59ce-ae5a-2a561b8a9f0a |       334 | www.website.com | crios         | iOS        | mobile  | 375x812
 0262e952-38e5-574a-bf6c-1f16f6eb5786 |       252 | www.website.com | safari        | Mac OS     | laptop  | 834x1194
 199020fc-5857-5d15-afa2-984d3e4c5148 |       208 | www.website.com | ios-webview   | iOS        | mobile  | 393x852
 1cd4f507-d10f-5449-be64-8c324d5a87a1 |       205 | www.website.com | edge-chromium | Windows 10 | desktop | 1920x1080
 4b980cf4-fdeb-56ab-bba1-221f4c703cd3 |       198 | website.com     | ios           | iOS        | mobile  | 390x844
```

It's clear that views are accumulating across less sessions.

This means less distinct sessions are being created, which means something is making session ids be the same across different arguments.

The arguments used to generate the session UUID are `websiteId, hostname, ip, userAgent` and haven't changed:

https://github.com/umami-software/umami/blob/784237bfab6da8c960efac7fd1073b8e0f67dfd9/src/lib/session.ts#L66-L69

I checked how they're collected and it also hasn't changed (location data has changed, but they're not used in the UUID):

https://github.com/umami-software/umami/blob/784237bfab6da8c960efac7fd1073b8e0f67dfd9/src/lib/detect.ts#L124-L137

_Edit: the below is irrelevant, please read the next comment for the real issue_

The only thing that changed related to this that I found was that a monthly `salt()` was added as an argument to the hash that gets encoded into the UUID:

https://github.com/umami-software/umami/blob/784237bfab6da8c960efac7fd1073b8e0f67dfd9/src/lib/crypto.ts#L9-L19

This happened in [this commit](https://github.com/umami-software/umami/commit/f175534f5120bcbf807d2421b5232d48e102f261) trying to fix [this issue](https://github.com/umami-software/umami/issues/2311) and was released with v2.9.0.

I don't know how this could cause the problem, but it's the only related change that I found. Any other ideas?

### Database

PostgreSQL

title: Odd failure to collect stats ...
body:
### Describe the Bug I have been mighty busy and only noticed a while back (and still been too busy to deal with it) that our umami server has not collected data since August last. So, into the diagnostics. What I have divined this far is: 1. I'm running umami on port 3000 on a webserver behind a reverse proxy. 2. the dashboard renders fine and dandy 3. umami.js is served fine and dandy 4. umami.js attempts to access /api/collect which is returning 404. therein lies my momentary conundrum, to look more closely at another day. But for now, I log it in hope of some creative feedback or thoughts. I doubt I have an umami bug here, much more likely an installation bug. I have pulled and built and restarted but no improvement. What's puzzling me is that during the build a lot of routes are tested and a lot of /api/ routes but not /api/collect. Also on the console I'm console the failure is: XHROPTIONS .... CORS Preflight Did Not Succeed Oddly, testing with curl I see a 404 but also headers and a strange body returned: ``` $ curl -X OPTIONS -i https://myumami.place/api/collect HTTP/2 404 x-dns-prefetch-control: on x-frame-options: SAMEORIGIN content-security-policy: default-src 'self'; img-src *; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; connect-src 'self' api.umami.is; frame-ancestors 'self' undefined; x-powered-by: Next.js etag: "6yypk0rgpn1x8" content-type: text/html; charset=utf-8 content-length: 2492 vary: Accept-Encoding date: Mon, 22 Jan 2024 11:54:21 GMT access-control-allow-origin: * access-control-allow-methods: GET, POST, OPTIONS access-control-allow-headers: Content-Type server: lighttpd/1.4.63
bernd@bigfoot:~/Mounts/Shelob/home/sting/bin$ ``` I promise I will in coming days read the docs again for clues thus far missed. The frustration I have is it was collecting data fine until August, and something happened in August, an upgrade of some sort somewhere, that looks to have stopped it, and now drilling down produce confusing clues to my eye. ### Database PostgreSQL ### Relevant log output _No response_ ### Which browser are you using? (if relevant) Firefox ### How are you deploying your application? (if relevant) yarn start, under systemd, on port 3000, traffic directed by a lighttpd reverse proxy.

title: Error in initial Build & Deploy configuration on Netlify
body:
### Describe the Bug

When running Umami on Netlify following the instructions in [Running on Netlify](https://umami.is/docs/running-on-netlify), the **Build & Deploy**section has an invalid **Build command**. It uses `yarn run build-app`, which does not run database migrations and such.
This lead me to be unable to get things setup, changing the build command to `yarn run build` made everything work as expected.
When trying to login for the first time, the application fails with a generic `500 Server Error` with no additional information.

I am not sure _where_ this is done in Umami, otherwise I would have sent a PR instead of an issues.
The [running on Netlify](https://umami.is/docs/running-on-netlify) page does not mention anything about the need to have the database migrations run.

### Database

Any

### Relevant log output

The Next.js SSR handler outputs this:
```
Jan 20, 11:36:36 AM: 4480336f ERROR   ⨯ Error: @prisma/client did not initialize yet. Please run "prisma generate" and try to import it again.Jan 20,
11:36:36 AM: 4480336f ERROR  In case this error is unexpected for you, please report it in https://github.com/prisma/prisma/issues
```

### Which browser are you using? (if relevant)

_No response_

### How are you deploying your application? (if relevant)

Netlify

title: ✗ Failed to run sql file /db/postgresql/data-migration-v2.sql
body:
### Describe the Bug

Hi! I'm attempting to migrate my [v1 Supabase database to v2](https://github.com/umami-software/migrate-v1-v2/issues/7), via a Vercel deployment.

Unfortunately, I ran into the following error(s):

```Shell
yarn start
yarn run v1.22.10
$ node index.js
Running v0.15.0
✓ DATABASE_URL is defined.
✓ Database connection successful.
✓ Database v1 tables ready for migration.
✓ Database v2 tables found.
✓ Database is ready for migration.
✓ Starting v2 data migration. Please do no cancel this process, it may take a while.
PrismaClientKnownRequestError:
Invalid `prisma.$executeRawUnsafe()` invocation:


Raw query failed. Code: `42703`. Message: `column e.event_name does not exist`
    at Zr.handleRequestError (C:\.....\migrate-v1-v2\node_modules\@prisma\client\runtime\library.js:171:6414)
    at Zr.handleAndLogRequestError (C:\.....\migrate-v1-v2\node_modules\@prisma\client\runtime\library.js:171:5948)
    at Zr.request (C:\.....\migrate-v1-v2\node_modules\@prisma\client\runtime\library.js:171:5786)
    at async Proxy._request (C:\.....\migrate-v1-v2\node_modules\@prisma\client\runtime\library.js:174:10455)
    at async runSqlFile (C:\.....\migrate-v1-v2\index.js:277:9)
    at async migrateData (C:\.....\migrate-v1-v2\index.js:109:3)
    at async C:\.....\migrate-v1-v2\index.js:308:7 {
  code: 'P2010',
  clientVersion: '4.11.0',
  meta: { code: '42703', message: 'column e.event_name does not exist' }
}
✗ Failed to run sql file /db/postgresql/data-migration-v2.sql.
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

title: Update
Log IP address on failed login attempts
body:
This pull requests implements logging of the IP address on failed login attempts. This makes it possible to monitor Umami with an IPS like [Crowdsec](https://github.com/crowdsecurity/crowdsec).

I added an additional log line instead of modifying the existing `Login failed: ...` line, because I wanted to prevent the logging of sensible user data.

Closes #1314

title: Update schema.prisma
body: fix pgbouncer to supavisor migration issue

title: Bump follow-redirects from 1.15.3 to 1.15.4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [follow-redirects](https://github.com/follow-redirects/follow-redirects) from 1.15.3 to 1.15.4.
Commits
  • 6585820 Release version 1.15.4 of the npm package.
  • 7a6567e Disallow bracketed hostnames.
  • 05629af Prefer native URL instead of deprecated url.parse.
  • 1cba8e8 Prefer native URL instead of legacy url.resolve.
  • 72bc2a4 Simplify _processResponse error handling.
  • 3d42aec Add bracket tests.
  • bcbb096 Do not directly set Error properties.
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=follow-redirects&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=1.15.3&new-version=1.15.4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/umami-software/umami/network/alerts).

title: Difference in Page Views between Umami and Vercel Analytics
body: ### Describe the Bug I have both [Vercel Analytics](https://vercel.com/analytics) and Umami set up on my site, but they report very different Page Views numbers (and slightly different Visitors numbers). I am inclined to trust the Vercel numbers because Umami seems unrealistic. So it makes me think that perhaps Umami counts page views incorrectly sometimes. The issue mainly happens on `/path2`, which is a page that fetches data from the server with [useSWR](https://swr.vercel.app/) and which will often use `router.replace(href, {scroll: false})` to update the query params based on the user clicking around. **Umami** **Vercel Analytics** My specific questions: * Has anyone seen something like this? * Does anyone have suggestions on potential causes? Thank you for any help! ### Database PostgreSQL

title: Installation error: The engine "node" is incompatible with this module. Expected version ">=18.17.0". Got "16.20.2"
body:
### Describe the Bug

About three weeks ago I ran into a problem installing dependencies on Netlify. The problem still persists.

I get the following error when installing:
```
The engine "node" is incompatible with this module. Expected version ">=18.17.0". Got "16.20.2"
```

### Database

PostgreSQL

### Relevant log output

title: Track redirects in Next.js 14?
404: Tracking code from initial onboarding does not include eu subdomain
body:
### Describe the Bug

1. Start onboarding, choose EU
2. Copy/paste script tag from onboarding journey (e.g. <script async src="https://cloud.umami.is/script.js" data-website-id="UUID-goes-here"></script>
3. Deploy and see 404 response
4. Get tracking code from settings page
5. Now the URL includes the EU subdomain: <script async src="https://eu.umami.is/script.js" data-website-id="UUID-goes-here"></script>

### Database

Umami Cloud

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Update Localisation for Swedish language
body:
This PR includes updates to the Swedish translations 

Key updates include:

- Added missing translation
- Fixed any previously incorrect translations.

title: Update Localisation for Swedish language
fix: Hide Add Website button for View Only users
body: fixed #2433  bug please review

title: Public/Shared url: also share events data
body: ### Describe the feature or enhancement We can send custom data with an event like this: ``` html ... ``` These details are visible in UI, on the top left button, "Event data" ![image](https://github.com/umami-software/umami/assets/1588144/59311cc7-fe4a-40d3-afe6-9996975cb2f0) But I did not found this page when using a public/shared URL, I can see only events names, not details.

title: ⚠ Entire page /sso deopted into client-side rendering. https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/deopted-into-client-rendering /sso
body:

umami behaving like a static app, maybe prisma schema related problem
